concepts.summary: Early humans measured time using repeating natural events like sunrise/sunset, Moon phases, and seasons. They invented devices like sundials, water clocks, hourglasses, and candle clocks.
concepts.details: Sundials use shadows; water clocks use water flow; hourglasses use sand flow; candle clocks use burning marks. Ancient Indian water clocks (Ghatika-yantra) measured 24-minute intervals (ghati).
examples: Sundial
Water clock (flowing out or floating bowl type)
Hourglass
Candle clock

concepts.summary: Modern clocks use repeating processes like pendulum swings, quartz crystal vibrations, or atomic vibrations. Atomic clocks are extremely precise.
concepts.details: Pendulum clocks were invented by Huygens. Quartz clocks use crystal vibrations; atomic clocks use atom vibrations. Accuracy has improved from seconds per day to seconds over millions of years.
examples: Pendulum clock
Quartz watch
Atomic clock

concepts.summary: A simple pendulum has a bob suspended by a thread from a rigid support. It oscillates periodically when displaced and released.
concepts.details: One oscillation: bob goes from mean to one extreme, to other extreme, and back to mean. Time period is the time for one oscillation.
examples: Bob on a string swinging back and forth

concepts.summary: The time period depends only on the pendulum's length, not on the bob's mass. It is constant for a given length at a location.
concepts.details: Measured by timing multiple oscillations. This constant property is used in timekeeping devices like pendulum clocks.
examples: Pendulum of 100 cm length has a fixed time period

concepts.summary: The SI unit of time is the second (s). Larger units are minute (min) and hour (h). Correct notation is important.
concepts.details: 1 min = 60 s, 1 h = 60 min. Symbols are lowercase (s, min, h) without a full stop. Avoid 'sec' or 'hrs'.
examples: Expressing time: 2 h 30 min
Symbol: 60 s

concepts.summary: Modern life requires measuring tiny time intervals: milliseconds in sports, medicine, music, and microseconds in electronics.
concepts.details: Precise time measurement is crucial in races, ECG machines, digital recordings, and computing.
examples: Stopwatch measuring hundredths of a second
ECG measuring heartbeat intervals

concepts.summary: Speed is the distance covered per unit time. It tells how fast an object is moving.
concepts.details: Calculated as Speed = Total distance covered / Total time taken. SI unit is m/s; also common is km/h.
examples: A runner covering 100 m in 10 s has speed 10 m/s

concepts.summary: If two of speed, distance, or time are known, the third can be calculated using formulas.
concepts.details: Distance = Speed Ã— Time; Time = Distance / Speed. These are used for average speed.
examples: Bus moving at 50 km/h for 2 h covers 100 km
Train covering 360 km at 90 km/h takes 4 h

concepts.summary: Average speed is the total distance divided by total time, useful when speed varies during motion.
concepts.details: In this book, 'speed' means average speed. Real objects rarely move at constant speed for long.
examples: Car covering 60 km in 1 h, 70 km in next 1 h: average speed = total distance/total time

concepts.summary: An object moving along a straight line at constant speed is in uniform linear motion. It covers equal distances in equal time intervals.
concepts.details: Example: a train moving at steady speed on a straight track between two points. It is an idealization.
examples: Train moving at constant 80 km/h on straight track

concepts.summary: An object moving along a straight line with changing speed is in non-uniform linear motion. It covers unequal distances in equal time intervals.
concepts.details: Example: a train accelerating or decelerating. Most real-life motions are non-uniform.
examples: Car in city traffic speeding up and slowing down

concepts.summary: Vehicles have a speedometer (shows speed in km/h) and an odometer (measures total distance traveled).
concepts.details: These instruments help monitor vehicle speed and distance for safety and maintenance.
examples: Car dashboard showing speed and total km
